summary: Pokemon Card of the Day #1558: Rocky Helmet (Noble Victories)
title: Pokemon Card of the Day #1558: Rocky Helmet (Noble Victories)
body: The 5th generation of Pokemon did not lack for interesting Pokemon Tools. Rocky Helmet was just another in a long line of them. If it was attached to your Active Pokemon and that Pokemon was damaged by an opponent’s attack, you put 2 damage counters on the Attacking Pokemon. This was a nice, general purpose Pokemon Tool that could work well on almost anything. It was also rarely seen in high-level decks because better Pokemon Tools existed and you didn’t want to use up too much deck space on those. Other choices such as Eviolite, Exp. Share, Float Stone, Dark Claw, and Muscle Band were better in various decks while Rocky Helmet was legal. It did get 4 years to work with due to reprints, and while it was crowded out of all of those formats, it was still a very solid option that would always do something even if it wasn’t making it into many 60-card decks.

Share, Float Stone, Dark Claw, and Muscle Band were better in various decks while Rocky Helmet was legal. It did get 4 years to work with due to reprints, and while it was crowded out of all of those formats, it was still a very solid option that would always do something even if it wasn’t making it into many 60-card decks.

This was a nice, general purpose Pokemon Tool that could work well on almost anything. It was also rarely seen in high-level decks because better Pokemon Tools existed and you didn’t want to use up too much deck space on those. Other choices such as Eviolite, Exp. Share, Float Stone, Dark Claw, and Muscle Band were better in various decks while Rocky Helmet was legal. It did get 4 years to work with due to reprints, and while it was crowded out of all of those formats, it was still a very solid option that would always do something even if it wasn’t making it into many 60-card decks.

summary: Can you guess what gen is my favorite? The collection grows. Still on the lookout for typhlosion, mareep, flaffy, suicune, and...
body: Can you guess what gen is my favorite? The collection grows. Still on the lookout for typhlosion, mareep, flaffy, suicune, and lugia before I’m satisfied. I get these from a local comic and games store and they get them from people bringing in their collections to sell so I sure hope they get one in too. It’s also possible that they don’t put out all of their stock at once since one time they had a box of them over to the side instead of the shelf they’re normally kept on. Hopefully I will get the rest soon.

summary: Magical March 29: Pokemon I was really excited to do this day because I decided to make my absolute favorite Pokemon, Raichu,...
caption:
Magical March 29: Pokemon

I was really excited to do this day because I decided to make my absolute favorite Pokemon, Raichu, into a magical girl. I tried to make her the plush, cheerful electric cutie I love in the Pokemon series and I’m really happy with how she looks.

blog.name: pokegodsandmissingno
blog.title: P̵o̵K̸é̴G̸o̸D̷s̸ and Frightful Things to Come?
blog.description: There is a growing desire and expectation of humans here on Earth in making full contact with PoKéMoN who are still unknown. Back in 1995, when I saw my first UPM (Unindexed Pocket Monster), I found out very quickly that other people thought you were totally crazy if you said you saw such things. The world has changed quite a bit since then when I was a child. In fact, in late 1997, a poll taken in Kanto shows that for the first time ever, more than fifty percent of residents now believe in PokéGODS's. Since then, there have been polls that put the figure at over eighty percent or more.
